text: Another readings of a New York Times article that describes
the use case for crypto and Bitcoin in particular in Venezuela.
The value of traditional currency has basically dropped to zero.
In that kind of a situation,
It allows people to engage in basic transactions,
it allows them to obtain food,
it allows them to obtain medicine,
it lets value come into the economy,
and lets value leave the economy.
The value of crypto in failed states or in
situations involving a runaway inflation is I think entirely clear.
When you can't trust the law,
perhaps we're best off being able to trust the code.
